intro: Stachys germanica, commonly known as German hedge-nettle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. Stachys germanica is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in woodland or grassland habitats.
